message: Once the door closes, time finally starts to move again.
My shoulders heave as I gasp for breath. I feel like I just ran a marathon.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Haaah..."
I let out a trembling sigh and curl up on the bed.
My head still hurts. When I close my eyes, I can feel the throbbing waves crash over me. It's like my brain is turning to slush.
In the depths of my skull, terror still hums. My neck and ear still feel damp.
Koujaku was out of his mind. He wanted to hurt me, crush me. Of that, I am certain.
But somehow, my cry brought him to his senses.
That sensation...
<center>　――――　DESTROY　――――</center>
Was that... Scrap?
Is that what brought Koujaku back?
Granny said that my voice has power over people, that I can use it to manipulate minds and bend them to my will.
That depending on how I use it, I can destroy a person's mind―or kill them.
Did that power save me just now?
What would've happened... if Koujaku hadn't snapped out of it?
I can recall vividly the terror and the shame.
I was so scared, not only of what Koujaku might do, but also that we might never be able to go back to the way things were.
And now? Now what am I supposed to do? How am I supposed to face him?
After all this, can I really say that our relationship is still intact?
Isn't it already too late?
Maybe Koujaku and I are...
No.
I just can't imagine hating Koujaku. Not even after what he did.
I mean, it was fucking awful. But the thing that's really eating at me... is the fact that I don't know why it happened.
Even now, will he still refuse to talk?
Does he still want me to just shut up and wait?
...If you want to dig even deeper, you can enter a person's mind.
Granny said that my power can do that, too.
If I use it, maybe I can find out everything I've been wanting to know.
But... is that really the right thing to do?
<center>　――――　DESTROY　――――</center>
<center>　――――　DESTROY HIM　――――</center>
The voice that spoke amid the pain. It felt like quicksand, dragging me down; and also like a tornado, carrying me away.
It very nearly took control.
...What am I supposed to do?
A scratch at the door snaps me out of my thoughts.
What now?
I get up off the bed and walk to the door.
When I open it, I see a blue ball of fur looking up at me, tail wagging.

name: 蓮
message: "Aoba, are you okay?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "...Yeah."
I crouch down to pick him up.
The texture of his fur is something I know well, but this time, the sensation brings tears to my eyes. I bury my face in his fur.
My arm still aches where Koujaku grabbed me.

name: 蓮
message: "Aoba?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "...I'm okay."
I set Ren down on the floor.
...It's okay. I'm okay.
If I don't keep repeating those words in my head, I'm afraid I might collapse on the spot.
I put my disheveled clothes back in order and pick Ren up again before heading downstairs.
I retrieve my bag from the couch and put Ren inside.

name: 蓮
message: "Are we going out?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Yeah. I... could use some fresh air."

name: 蓮
message: "Oh."
I stroke Ren's head and head out the front door.
It's still raining, but not as hard as before. The fresh air is soothing, if only a little.
No need for an umbrella. I walk out into the rain.
